title-group.article-title: The Performance of Overconfident Fund Managers

abstract.p: Using data for 193 equity funds in Taiwan, we examine whether fund managers behave overconfidently. We show that the higher the fund performance, the more that trading occurs in the next period. In addition, such trading may hurt subsequent performance, although the evidence is marginal. Our findings suggest that managers of equity funds in Taiwan are overconfident.
